job_description:
• Collaborate to support Advanced Node Place & Route challengesMulti-die design Minimum of 8+ years of physical design experience including RTL to GDSII full flow experience.
• Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills.
• Hands-on experience in synthesis, physical design, static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS, and power analysis.
• Scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python).
• A continuous learner, always seeking to expand your technical knowledge and skills.
• Providing technical and engineering insight to support and improve the usability, applicability, and adoption of Synopsys products.
• Diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving complex technical issues on customer installations.
• Deploying and training customers on new implementations and capabilities.

• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• Software Engineer & Computer Science - Recent Grad/Full Time Locations United States Posting Dates08/29/2025 Trending As a Recent Graduate here at Honeywell, you will have the opportunity to kickstart your career by working alongside experienced professionals in a dynamic and innovative environment.
